programme.title: Commando Missions
programme.desc: The Heraklion Operation, carried out in June 1942. Major Georges Berges team landed in Crete and moved across land, intending destroy Luftwaffe planes at Heraklion airfield. They destroyed about 20 Ju 88s, but despite escaping from the airfield found their retreat betrayed

programme.title: Commando Missions
programme.desc: Operation Frankton, of December 1942. The mission was for Royal Marines to place limpet mines on German ships in the occupied Bordeaux Harbour, 62 miles along the Gironde River. Five cockleshell canoes set off from submarine HMS Tuna at the mouth of the river. Only two reached the harbour and carried out the raid, escaping with the aid of the French Resistance. The damage to the ships and the resulting disruption to German supply lines had a significant impact on the war effort

programme.title: WWIIs Most Daring Raids
programme.desc: The efforts of Norwegian resistance fighters to return to their invaded homeland to carry out a daring mission to raid and destroy a hydroelectric plant where the Germans were stockpiling a chemical needed for nuclear weapons research

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Dan Jones explores the turbulent history of six of Britains most famous castles, his journey commencing with a visit to Edinburgh Castle. A popular tourist attraction to this day, Dan explores the history of this famous stronghold that began as an Iron Age battle base and remains a military facility to this day, and was the target of the worlds first aerial bombing

programme.title: The Great British Dig: History in Your Back Garden
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis is joined by a team of expert archaeologists to excavate back gardens around Britain, uncovering the lost history buried beneath our lawns and flower beds. In the first episode, Hugh and the team attempt to uncover a Roman fort, connected to Hadrians Wall, that is buried beneath the back gardens of the quiet suburban streets of Benwell in Newcastle-upon-Tyne

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: The north of England is so rich in archaeological finds that Alice Roberts travels back there once again to reveal more of its fascinating history. She and the team examine a Roman fort on Hadrians Wall, evidence of early writing by the Picts in Scotland, and a 3,000-year-old Bronze Age coffin buried under a golf course

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: To enter space, humans require a space suit. Are the aliens that are said to have visited Earth any different, or are they more akin to artificial drones?

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: A look at the worlds hottest UFO zones, where physical and paranormal phenomena, unidentified objects and aliens are reported with alarming frequency

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Investigating evidence that suggests the worlds governments could be on the verge of announcing everything they know about UFOs

programme.title: WWIIs Most Daring Raids
programme.desc: In July 1943 the Allied Forces had evicted the Axis powers from North Africa and could finally begin the Italian Campaign. The first mission was Operation Husky, a massive amphibious invasion of the island of Sicily

programme.title: WWIIs Most Daring Raids
programme.desc: The events of December 1941 when under cover of a fierce naval bombardment, a taskforce of elite British commandos sailed toward the Norwegian town of South Vaagso

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson hikes up from Lyme Regis on Dorsets Jurassic Coast to the Somerset Levels in the footsteps of a ragtag rebel army led by the young Duke of Monmouth, the illegitimate son of Charles II. He sailed in from Holland around Lymes famous Cobb with a handful of soldiers, believing the people would support him in overthrowing the newly crowned James II, who was also Monmouths uncle, but, more importantly, Roman Catholic. The year was 1685 and the country was riven by anti-Catholic feeling mixed up with revolutionary zeal. Monmouth marched through the fiercely independent towns of Devon, gathering support from artisans and farmworkers. Meeting up with Billy Bragg in Colyton, Tony learns about the kind of people prepared to risk their lives for the Monmouth Rebellion

programme.title: The Great British Dig: History in Your Back Garden
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis and the archaeologists set out to uncover evidence of a secret military base on the clifftops of South Shields, hopping to become the first to put these important pieces of wartime history on the map

programme.title: The Nostradamus Effect
programme.desc: Examining apocalyptic prophecies and their plausibility throughout history

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There

programme.desc: Tony Harris and his team of experts probe reports of a serpent-like creature caught on camera. Plus, whether the discovery of an ancient antenna found beneath the waters of Antarctica offers proof that the Nazis once colonised the South Pole

programme.title: Royal Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: The mysterious death of the Duke of Kent in a 1942 plane crash, which has led to accusations of the Royal family erasing him from history

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.sub-title: Unrepentant: The SS and Its Myth After 1945
programme.desc: The myth of the SS has lived on after 1945. Many Nazi perpetrators fled to exile unscathed with the help of the Vatican or the US intelligence services. Yet some did not escape punishment and were forced to confront their responsibility. Although the atrocities of the SS are beyond all doubt, among current far-right groups, there is a cult surrounding old comrades and SS symbolism

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Conquest of the Skies
programme.desc: The veteran naturalist examines the world of flight, travelling across the globe to chart the evolutionary story of those creatures who seemingly defy the rules of gravity by taking to the air. Initially focusing on insects, Attenborough meets a descendant of the dragonfly, before examining the Atlas beetle, which tends to restrict flight to times when it needs a mate or a fresh supply of food. More aesthetically pleasing is a group of beautiful tropical butterflies, followed by an in-depth study into the blow fly - the jet fighter of insects

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Conquest of the Skies
programme.desc: The veteran naturalist visits the jungles of Borneo to meet creatures that like to glide through life - the harlequin tree frog and the little-known colugo - often referred to, incorrectly, as a flying lemur. He also has a CGI-assisted encounter with the first true vertebrate flyer, the pterosaur, receives a flying lesson from a small flock of swans at Loch Lomond in Scotland and encounters the planets largest species of bat

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Conquest of the Skies
programme.desc: The veteran naturalist turns his attention to creatures that dominate the skies today. He begins with the vast bird family, watching a group of vultures as they go scavenging and some peregrine falcons dive bombing for their prey. He then moves on to the floating forests of Ecuador to find out what makes the humble hummingbird tick, before ending his journey at the Gomantong bat caves of Borneo - a place he first filmed in 1972 - witnessing a mass exodus of the creatures

programme.desc: When a woman pushes away a sniffer dog officers hone in on what she has stuffed in her underwear. Fly-on-the-wall documentary following security staff at Australias biggest airports

programme.title: Live Tennis
programme.desc: The ATP Paris Masters. Coverage of day five of the ATP 1000 event, a hard-court tournament at Accor Arena, where the quarter-finals take place. Only one of the last-four matches 12 months ago went into a third set, with Holger Rune emerging with a 6-4, 4-6, 7-5 win over Alex de Minaur. Elsewhere, Frances Ugo Humbert followed up his spectacular triumph over Carlos Alcaraz with a 6-2, 7-6 victory over Jordan Thompson, while Alexander Zverev and Grigor Dimitrov also progressed to the semi-finals by beating Stefanos Tsitsipas and Karen Khachanov, respectively

programme.title: Live EFL
programme.desc: Wrexham v Coventry City (Kick-off 8.00pm). Coverage of the Championship match from StoK Racecourse. This is the first ever meeting between these two sides at this level and just the second in any competition since the turn of the century. The last fixture time these two teams met was back in January 2023 when Wrexham won a thrilling FA Cup tie 4-3, with the hosts scoring three goals in the first half to shock the Sky Blues

programme.title: Live Tennis
programme.desc: The ATP Paris Masters. Coverage of day five of the ATP 1000 event, a hard-court tournament at Accor Arena, where the quarter-finals take place. Only one of the last-four matches 12 months ago went into a third set, with Holger Rune emerging with a 6-4, 4-6, 7-5 win over Alex de Minaur. Elsewhere, Frances Ugo Humbert followed up his spectacular triumph over Carlos Alcaraz with a 6-2, 7-6 victory over Jordan Thompson, while Alexander Zverev and Grigor Dimitrov also progressed to the semi-finals by beating Stefanos Tsitsipas and Karen Khachanov, respectively

programme.title: Live EFL
programme.desc: Wrexham v Coventry City (Kick-off 8.00pm). Coverage of the Championship match from StoK Racecourse. This is the first ever meeting between these two sides at this level and just the second in any competition since the turn of the century. The last fixture time these two teams met was back in January 2023 when Wrexham won a thrilling FA Cup tie 4-3, with the hosts scoring three goals in the first half to shock the Sky Blues

The Willie Clancy Summer School represents all aspects of the tradition - the learners, the festival enthusiasts, the dancers, the singers, the discerning listeners, the young musicians and the professionals. This programme features music from Noel Hill, Liam O Connor, Tim Dennehy, Eimear Howley, the OLoughlin family and Andrew Caden

programme.title: The Far Country
programme.desc: A cowpoke is steering his cattle north to the Canadian border when a corrupt sheriff commandeers the herd. A local saloon-bar owner falls for the hapless cowboy, and with her help he recaptures his cattle. Hooking up with a wagon train, the couple head for the mining town of Dawson, but the thwarted and embittered sheriff is on their tail. Western, with James Stewart, Walter Brennan and Ruth Roman

programme.title: Into the Wind
programme.desc: The efforts of Terry Fox who, three years after having his right leg amputated above the knee, set out to raise funds for cancer research by running a marathons distance each day across Canada. In 143 days, he covered 3,339 miles, steadily capturing the heart of a nation with his marathon of hope and inspiring millions

programme.title: Paddy Devlin - Gunnadoir na Gaillimhe
programme.desc: Elayne Devlin explores why her uncle Paddy and nearly 70,000 other men from southern Ireland ignored Irish neutrality to fight for Britain. Teenager Paddy Devlin became one of the top snipers in the British Army, fought on D-Day and was seriously wounded in Germany. Men who joined up to fight the Nazis were given a warm welcome in Britain during the war, but Ireland was a cold house for them on their return. The huge involvement of Irishmen and women in the British war effort was ignored until recently. This documentary tells their story for the first time, through the eyes of one local hero

programme.title: No Tears

programme.title: Cannonball
programme.desc: Andrew Flintoff hosts the action-packed game show, in which 24 contestants are tasked with traversing a series of water-based challenges and custom-made inflatable obstacles, each designed to test their speed, accuracy, height and distance. The most successful contestants then claim a chance to launch themselves cannonball-style at a moving target on the surface of a deep-water tank, all in the hope of nabbing the shows priceless Cannonball Cup. Frankie Bridge, Radzi Chinyanganya, Ryan Hand and Maya Jama all join Andrew at the poolside to commentate on the action

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A new recruit fresh out of training school makes her mark when she uncovers 12kg of cocaine hidden in a car that she has stopped on one of the bridges

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Customs and Border Protection officers think they have spotted a trend when they seize drugs from behind the dashboards of two cars. A Mexican woman asks officers for protection

programme.title: Cape Carnage: Killer Catch
programme.desc: The crew of the Wildcard battle sharks, a giant crocodile, chronic injury, arguments and persistent fog that all threaten to derail their season target and pay

programme.title: Cape Carnage: Killer Catch
programme.desc: The crew of the Wildcard are just over two tonnes short of their 45-tonne goal as they fight for their last chance at a killer catch at Cape Carnage with sharks circling

programme.title: Celebrity Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Joe Wilkinson, Ulrika Jonsson, Mark Watson and Jenny Eclair are amongst the Hampshire auction hunters that Sean Kelly has to rein in as they haggle for storage lots

programme.title: Celebrity Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Vic and Bob, Theo Paphitis, Janet Street Porter, Stephen K Amos, Justin Moorhouse, Ellie Taylor and Phil Tufnell take part in Lewes. Sean Kelly hosts

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: Luke and his team are contracted to remove two stolen vehicles from an abandoned mine site that has been turned into a recreational lake for weekend campers and water skiers. The missing cars are toxic and they have a 15,000-dollar budget and two days to get the job done

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May test the KTM X-Bow, the Morgan Three Wheeler and the Caterham R500 at Donington Park racing circuit. Jeremy also creates his own version of the Battle of Britain using an aircraft-engined Bentley and a flame-spitting BMW

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May set out to discover if they can go motor racing for less than it costs to play golf. Theres also a double helping of guests, with rock star Slash and Formula One driver Kimi Raikkonen taking to the track in Reasonably Priced Cars. Richard also gets behind the wheel of the BMW M5, which is powered by a twin-turbo V8 engine instead of the high-revving V10 of its predecessor

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers celebrate British pork, preparing a traditional gala pie and a rolled loin with apricots and ginger. They also explore the role the pig has played in the UKs history and travel to a farm in Gloucestershire to visit a couple raising rare breeds

programme.title: Rick Steins Taste of Shanghai
programme.desc: Rick Stein finds out if Shanghai has hung on to its culinary roots and wants to add a few more dishes to his Chinese repertoire. He samples rich red braised pork - a favourite of Chairman Mao, hairy crabs and dumplings that sag under the weight of the hot liquid inside and burst at the slightest touch

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Miles Jupp and Bob Mortimer and actresses Samantha Morton and Sarah Hadland join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Yasmine Akram, Cariad Lloyd, Geoff Norcott and Dennis Taylor test their general knowledge skills and keep their eyes on the prize before the weeks winner is announced

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Roger Black, Jo Brand, Sanjeev Kohli and Tiff Stevenson keep their eyes on the prize as Richard Osman asks the questions, and eventually announces the weeks winner

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Panellists Julia Zemiro, Matt Lucas and David Mitchell and Alan Davies compete, as Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the comedy quiz show. In this edition, the presenter meditates on matters medieval and macabre, and as usual, he poses questions that are so difficult, points are awarded for the answers he finds most interesting

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Broadcaster David Dimbleby takes over the reins for an extended edition of the satirical quiz from April 2019, with investigative journalist Stacey Dooley and comedian Henning Wehn joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats

programme.title: Railroad Australia

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race

programme.title: Guy Martins Great British Power Trip
programme.desc: As an energy crisis and cost of living crisis collide, the Lincolnshire lorry mechanic and motorcycle racer investigates the past, present and future of British power stations to work out how the country makes its most valuable commodity of all - electricity. This first episode begins with Guy testing every piece of equipment in his workshop to find out which items use the most electricity. Horrified by what hes now having to pay for power, he tries to work out the reasons behind his big bills, and visits his local power station at Drax - which also happens to be the countrys biggest

programme.title: Extreme Fishing with Robson Green
programme.desc: The actor casts off in China, where fishing is a very important skill. At Qiandao Lake in Zhekiang, he joins 100 locals in trying to land a bighead carp and samples the revered catch. More culinary experiences await as a result of Robsons hunt for octopus, and he tries his hand at cormorant fishing - but has trouble restraining his birds constant efforts to escape

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Host Rob Brydon and captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack welcome Angellica Bell, Bob Mortimer, Suggs and Holly Willoughby to the comedy panel show on which the teams reveal extraordinary stories about themselves. But are they telling the truth, or are they making it all up?

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Singer Sophie Ellis-Bextor, actress Briony May Williams and comedians Loyiso Gola and Jason Manford join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Ghosts
programme.desc: Fortune smiles on Mike and Alison when a TV company comes calling, looking for an old house in which to film a period drama. But to get the money in the bank, Alison must ensure the shoot goes without a hitch despite the horde of curious ghosts, the houses crumbling floorboards and her crippling crush on the shows lead actor. Meanwhile, Thomas and Lady Button learn the meaning of a free pass, and Julian tries his luck at betting on horse racing. Comedy, starring Charlotte Ritchie, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Simon Farnaby

programme.title: Ghosts
programme.desc: Learning that their posh neighbours the Beg-Chetwyndes have an ancient claim over their land, Mike and Alison throw an upmarket dinner party to help resolve a thorny issue. But with the ghosts her only guide to high-class decorum, the evening starts badly and only gets worse - thanks to Marys woeful catering, Mikes clueless deal-making and Robins raucous celebration of the lunar eclipse. Elsewhere, the spooks become obsessed with a TV sitcom. Comedy, guest starring Geoff McGivern and Sophie Thompson

programme.title: Ghosts
programme.desc: A luxury hotel chain makes penniless and exhausted couple Mike and Alison an offer they cant refuse, but the prospect of their departure drives a wedge between the ghosts, and the hardline Captain finds himself ostracised, while Pat is voted in as reluctant leader. As the clueless spirits brainstorm money-making schemes, the Captain takes matters into his own hands. Meanwhile, fortune smiles on Headless Humphrey in his ceaseless search for his errant body

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: As Lee Mack brings the popular sitcom to an end, a chance to see some of the unintentionally comic moments during filming that ended up on the cutting-room floor

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Seven years into their marriage, Lee and Lucy face the daily onslaught of raising Charlie and his twin siblings, five-year-olds Benji and Molly. Lovably feckless father Frank remains around and close friends including world-weary Toby and uptight ice-queen Anna are still on the scene. Thankfully, Lucys more dependable parents Geoffrey and Wendy can be relied upon when the going gets tough. However, while juggling the ongoing needs of those around him, the pair disagree about the best way to keep the romance alive. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy offends father-in-law Frank by casting doubt on his ability to mind the children while she and Lee enjoy an evening out at the ballet. Sally Bretton co-stars, alongside veteran comedy performer Bobby Ball and Outnumbereds Hugh Dennis

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Leslie discovers Ron secretly goes on a hunting trip every year, and decides to invite herself and the rest of her colleagues along. However, the plan seems distinctly unwise when one of the party gets injured. Meanwhile, April is left to hold the fort at the office, and makes an unlikely friend

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Leslie is horrified to learn Tom is getting divorced, and urges his colleagues to offer their support. However, her suspicions are aroused when he seems strangely cheerful about the split. Meanwhile, Andy makes a ham-fisted attempt to undermine Mark and Anns relationship

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Leslie accidentally becomes the subject of a tabloid scandal after being pictured talking to notoriously promiscuous councillor Bill Dexhart - who does not seem particularly interested in helping to clear her name. Meanwhile, Ron struggles to cover Leslies duties, Dave has a big decision to make and April asks Andy to help her buy Christmas presents

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Former Labour home secretary Alan Johnson takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from April 2019, with comedian Janey Godley and journalist and political commentator Tim Shipman joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon introduces the funniest moments from the comedy panel show that werent originally shown in the series 14 episodes. Among the guests joining team captains Lee Mack and David Mitchell are Claudia Winkleman, Dan Walker, AJ Odudu, Samantha Morton, Miles Jupp, Roisin Conaty, Sara Barron, Chris McCausland, Gemma Cairney, Bob Mortimer, Sara Pascoe, Mr Motivator, Ed Gamble, the Rev Kate Bottley, Sophie Hermann, Dr Xand van Tulleken and Sindhu Vee

programme.title: Australian Ninja Warrior
programme.desc: From everyday heroes to Ozs top sportsmen and women, Australian athletes are all lining up to take their shot at the most difficult obstacle course in the world

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade returns with the offbeat tourism show and is joined in the first edition by comedy actress and writer Dawn French, with the pair spending two days in the Greek capital. Their mini-break features doughnuts, the Acropolis and the thermal waters of Lake Vouliagmeni, which is rumoured to be the goddess Athenas favourite bathing spot. Richard and Dawn sample a 14-course tasting menu at a temple to molecular gastronomy, before they go on an Olympic tour featuring discus and javelin training

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: New recruit Andy Butcher is overjoyed to be going on a live-firing exercise almost straight away, but soon makes a devastating mistake. programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Michelle and Wendy both learn some truths about their families pasts, while George tries to discover why one of her patients is acting in a strange manner. Meanwhile, the day of the police surgeon interviews dawns. Sarah Matravers guest stars

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Jimmi has his 30th birthday but doesnt feel like celebrating, especially after Michelle confides in him. Nick overhears Julia and Joe discussing the police surgeon job. Adrian Lewis Morgan and Donnaleigh Bailey star

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: As the day of Jesss abortion arrives, she continues agonising over whether or not to go ahead, but Alex remains determined. Meanwhile, an oblivious Ric concentrates his efforts on organising his birthday celebrations, Sam spends her time stirring things up - and when Jess collapses during the party the sparks really begin to fly

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Dixie appears to be her old self again when she stands up to a mob, but is inwardly still struggling to rebuild her confidence. Abs refuses to go to Staceys funeral, and his emotional state leads him to jump to conclusions about a patient. Adam spreads a rumour about Jordan, and an unwelcome face returns

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Burnside finds himself on the wrong side of the law after making his return to Sun Hill. Chris Ellison stars

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: As the Mitchells struggle to cope with their tragedy, Ronnies grief leads her into a deception. Archie fights to get his family back, and has Janine found herself a new ally?

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Back in all her former glory, Peggy takes matters into her own hands. Darren finds help from an unexpected source, while Stacey delivers some home truths to Ronnie

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Colette is overjoyed to learn that the Fusiliers will shortly be leaving for South Africa, and tries to persuade Joe that it would be the ideal place to get married. Marsha learns that Michael has been having an affair and resolves to fight for him, no matter what it takes

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Archie faces losing the estate as he struggles to find a way to pay off Hectors death duties, and Greg capitalises on the situation by offering to buy the property - but just when all seems lost an affluent traveller offers a solution to the predicament. Meanwhile, Irenes secret past threatens to destroy her relationship with Duncan

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: The Jersey detective becomes an unwelcome guest at a wedding while investigating an attack on a curate. Drama, starring John Nettles and Terence Alexander

programme.title: The Upper Hand
programme.desc: Tom arranges blind dates for both his mother and Charlie on Valentines Day. Needless to say, both are shocked when they learn the identity of their companions. Diana Weston and Joe McGann star

programme.title: Terry and June
programme.desc: The duo win a giant jigsaw, which proves to be a dangerous pastime, especially when a vital piece goes missing. Comedy, starring Terry Scott and June Whitfield

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo gets out his old motorbike and tries to perform a few stunts - much to the surprise of Blamire and Clegg. Bill Owen, Michael Bates and Peter Sallis star

programme.desc: When a police team-building trip takes a sinister turn Sister Boniface must discover which of their rivals is a murderer

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Standing and the team reinvestigate the 50-year-old murder of Frederick Tully, a wages clerk at Battersea Power Station. Discovering new evidence that leads them to doubt the man executed for the crime was guilty, they question the validity of the original case against him. Drama, guest starring George Cole, Roy Hudd and Jan Francis

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Part one of two. DS Boyd investigates whether a woman who confessed to the killing of her husband 25 years ago could be innocent. Startling new facts come to light when Annie Keels son, now living under a new identity, has to relive the trauma of the night of the murder. Drama, guest starring Lynda Bellingham

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Ram-raiders destroy a valuable Sheraton desk and steal what they havent broken, forcing the roguish dealer to scout around for new stock. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Doriens husband goes missing, and shes later seen digging a suspiciously man-shaped hole in the garden, prompting Sharon and Tracey to fear their neighbour has taken to murder. Lesley Joseph stars, with Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharons husband Chris sees a family tragedy as the perfect opportunity to escape from prison. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: The discovery of a body sparks the reopening of a murder case Crabbe and Fisher thought they had solved 18 years previously, prompting fears they convicted the wrong man. Culinary crime drama, starring Richard Griffiths

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Henry Crabbe takes on a group of conservationists who are opposed to the building of a new motorway link. Culinary drama, starring Richard Griffiths

programme.title: Father Brown

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A car in which a teacher was murdered five years earlier is returned to its owner - the victims husband. Pullman reopens the unsolved case, hoping to track down the dead womans secret lover, who is known to have had a small tattoo - a clue that eventually leads to a male prostitute. Detective drama, starring Amanda Redman, James Bolam, Dennis Waterman and Alun Armstrong

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team is asked to reinvestigate the 1975 death of a union leader, whose body was found in the Thames. As the detectives delve deeper into the case, a financial scandal involving misappropriated funds is uncovered and a Labour peer points the finger of suspicion at the victims deputy, but Brians increasingly erratic behaviour threatens to hamper the inquiry. Frances Barber, Kenneth Cranham and Dave Hill guest star

programme.title: Mrs Sidhu Investigates
programme.desc: The crime-solving caterer has a gig at a major boxing championship match when a boxer is kidnapped and held at ransom

programme.title: Whitstable Pearl
programme.desc: When Dolly complains about strange occurrences at home, Pearl is concerned about her mental well-being but sets up security cameras - leading to a surprising discovery

programme.title: Whitstable Pearl
programme.desc: Pearl caters for a wedding at a theme park, and when the bride is found dead in the hall of mirrors she cannot resist investigating

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries

programme.title: Rebus

Ken Stott stars as Ian Rankins jaded detective, with Claire Price and Cora Bissett

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: When You Take a Good Bite, Yorkshire Tastes Terrible
programme.desc: When Clegg receives news of an old friend dying in America, Compo and Seymour join him on a journey down memory lane, recalling time spent at school walking on gates and climbing trees - forgetting, of course, that it was many years ago. Poignant instalament of the long-running comedy, featuring the final appearance of Joe Gladwin as Wally Batty

However, it seems that Eds recommended surgeon may cut corners to save a bob or two

programme.title: Toast of London
programme.desc: London is having the hottest weather since weather began, Eds Australian nephew has come to stay, and the Blue Spruce furniture fad is spreading like wildfire. Meanwhile, Steven begs Jane to get him in at the Globe Theatre, and he is less than impressed with the director, Daz Klondyke. However, when he is cast in an all-dog version of Twelfth Night, he gets his fingers burnt during his quest to become a real actor. Conclusion of the third series of the comedy, starring Matt Berry, Doon Mackichan and Robert Bathurst

Comedy written by and starring Sian Gibson, with Conleth Hill and Rosie Cavaliero

programme.desc: Basils belief that guests are an obstacle to the smooth running of his hotel is borne out by the arrival of an aggressive woman (Joan Sanderson), and the tension between the two leads to a series of increasingly heated arguments. Classic comedy, starring John Cleese, Prunella Scales, Andrew Sachs and Connie Booth

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: Basil goes to great lengths to prove to Sybil that a guest has smuggled a woman into his room. Instead the hotelier keeps being caught in compromising situations with a young Australian woman, and a visiting psychiatrist finds his increasingly manic behaviour both fascinating and alarming. Classic comedy first broadcast in 1979, starring John Cleese and Prunella Scales

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: Manuels pet rat escapes just as a health inspector is about to pay a fact-finding visit, sending Basil on a mad dash to track it down before disaster ensues. Madcap comedy, starring John Cleese, Prunella Scales and Andrew Sachs

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucys worries about the age gap between her and Guy increase when he turns up with his grandson. A family emergency means Lee and Tim are left in charge of the youngster, but their babysitting skills leave a lot to be desired. Sitcom, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton

programme.title: Bottom 2001: A*** Oddity Live
programme.desc: Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson star in a stage show based on the comedy series, in which toilet humour is rife as the duo find themselves stranded on a Pacific island

programme.title: Inside No 9
programme.desc: Animation looking at the impact the Wise Owl public information films from the 1970s had on young people, told through the eyes of Ronnie, who has spent his entire life trying to do the right thing. Starring Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith

programme.title: The Power of Parker
programme.desc: Diane puts her trust in Kath, sending her on a covert mission to Martins office while she reluctantly accompanies her spouse to a dinner party at Sandy Coopers home. In a desperate attempt to address his financial woes, Martin tries to impress Sandy and Vinnie Hayes to secure the treasury job and get his hands on the Rotary Club float. Comedy written by and starring Sian Gibson, with Conleth Hill and Rosie Cavaliero

programme.title: The Power of Parker
programme.desc: Its the big day for Kath and Diane as they attempt to finally exact their revenge on Martin. However, while Diane has never felt more alive, Kath seems to be having second thoughts. Comedy, written by and starring Sian Gibson, with Rosie Cavaliero, Conleth Hill, Sheila Reid and Steve Pemberton

programme.title: Not Going Out

programme.title: The Cockfields
programme.desc: Simon is persuaded to mark the occasion of his 40th birthday back at the Cockfield family home, so takes his girlfriend Donna along to the Isle of Wight. The duo soon find themselves spending a long weekend as guests of his ever-doting mother Sue and controlling stepfather Ray, together with their menagerie of relatives and friends. Comedy, starring Joe Wilkinson, Diane Morgan, Sue Johnston and Bobby Ball

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Nick Knowles Big House Clearout
programme.desc: The presenter helps more families who are being crushed by their clutter. He begins in Portsmouth, where three generations are squeezed together in a three-bed semi thats bursting at the seams in an extraordinary challenge full of emotion and memories. When Sarahs husband Trevor suddenly passed away, she had to return from Dubai to her old house - in which her daughter Stevie and five-year-old grand-daughter were living. Coping with grief, Sarah was unable to face sorting through a lifetime of belongings, so for a year, the house has been totally packed with clutter from the attic to the outhouses, and its become the way they live

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: Homes for Veterans - Part Two
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team continue with their most ambitious project to date, with the assistance of the local community and two royal helpers, Prince William and Prince Harry. The second edition sees them create a home for a veteran, who is a triple amputee after an IED blew up in Afghanistan. They are also aiming to renovate the fronts of the houses on the street and put in new utilities, as well as creating a lasting legacy in the form of a support centre, which will help other veterans find homes and jobs

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: In this Children in Need Special, the DIY SOS team joins forces with Radio 2. Their mission is to transform a derelict site into a safe base for a young womens charity in Leeds

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: Children in Need Special 2013
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team descend on Caswell Bay, Swansea, to transform a dilapidated, out-of-use bus shelter a fully adapted centre for Surfability UK, a charity that provides surfing lessons and experiences for people with disabilities and learning difficulties. Throughout, Nick presents stories of how children and young people have benefitted from the support of the charity, but the challenge remains tough as this is the teams first build during Covid-19

programme.title: MasterChef Australia: Dessert Masters
programme.desc: In the seasons second elimination, the contestants must create their own version of traditional Australian desserts - and must include either blueberries or apples in their dish

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: V and Ollie race to a rugby pitch to help a man who has had a seizure. Sam and Tom are called to the home of a three-year-old girl whos suffered an allergic reaction to yoghurt

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: A skier falls over on a steep slope and suffers a suspected brain injury in Wakefield and a DIY enthusiasts attempts to fix the heating in his chilly home end in disaster

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: The start of the new school term leads to a spate of stabbings and a forester is badly injured in an accident involving a chainsaw deep in woods near Keighley

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Edina finally gets round to redesigning her kitchen following the blaze caused by chain-smoking best friend Patsy - and embarks on a whirlwind visit to New York in search of the perfect doorknob. Award-winning comedy, starring Jennifer Saunders, Joanna Lumley, Julia Sawalha and Jane Horrocks

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Patsys sister, who has a reputation for wild living, arrives in time to throw the glamorous socialites New Year party plans into disarray. Jennifer Saunders and Joanna Lumley star, with guest Kate OMara

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Edina decides her bedroom is not big enough, and with Patsy eager for them to throw an orgy, it now seems like the ideal time to make a few changes - much to the disapproval of strait-laced daughter Saffy. Comedy, starring Jennifer Saunders, Joanna Lumley and Julia Sawalha

programme.title: DNA Family Secrets
programme.desc: Georgina was conceived during a holiday romance 34 years ago when her mother fell for a Portuguese waiter, and now, she wants to know if her father is still alive. Matthew grew up in foster care never knowing where his father came from, and he longs to discover the truth about his ancestry and if he is actually Caribbean

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson examines how different days require certain types of food, sharing her favourite menu to help get that balance right in the kitchen. She prepares a light salad of salmon, avocado, watercress and pumpkin seeds, and a chicken shawarma with an array of spices, sauces and flatbreads - a dish inspired by a spit-roasted Lebanese kebab that is perfect for feeding a crowd. Nigella also creates two sweet treats, a glossy liquorice and blackcurrant chocolate cake, and chocolate chip cookie dough pots served with ice-cream or creme fraiche

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. The evidence of the videotape convinces Karen Parks her husband has been abusing their daughter. CID arrest him on suspicion of murder, but CCTV footage from an off licence provides him with a cast-iron alibi for the time of Chloes death and he is released without charge. Wills persistence leads to a tense encounter and Callum resorts to desperate measures to ensure justice is served. Chris Walker guest stars

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Phils latest conquest Monica Dreyfuss reports a burglary at her home which has left her bruised, shaken and fearing for her life. A series of beatings on a local estate points to a vigilante campaign against trouble-making drug dealers and the case touches a nerve with Will as he struggles to get over Martin Parks suicide. Michael Brandon and Anna Wing guest star

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A masked kidnapper threatens to kill Monica if Phil does not return with the money Louis Dreyfuss owes his boss. Samantha is shocked to learn of his involvement in the case but allows her old partner to carry on with his undercover operation to the point of handing over the money - not realising Phils philandering ways have made him more than one new enemy. Michael Brandon guest stars

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: An abandoned car leads Callum and Will to a woman caught up in a tragic love triangle in which jealousy explodes into violence as the aggrieved husband stabs his rival and then threatens to kill himself. Meanwhile, a man trying to obtain his birth certificate at a register office discovers his identity has been stolen, alerting Sally and Tony to an extensive benefit fraud scam. Emma Samms and Stephen McGann guest star

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The anger and frustration caused by the Martin Parks suicide boils over when Will corners an arrogant young thief at the top of a block of flats and holds him over the edge of the balcony. Emma and Nikki answer a call to a domestic affray when a man suspects his wife of conducting a cyber affair and beats up his supposed rival

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: Paramedics Jeff and Tamara race to help an elderly man who has flipped his mobility scooter, while another patient has stopped breathing after overdosing on heroin

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: Armahn and Ash help a 20-year-old man who has been hit by a van while on his electric scooter, while Shane and Shelly assist a woman suffering with pain in her breast

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: Critical care paramedics Andrew and John race to help two people involved in a severe motorbike accident., while the operation centres deal with a high volume of emergency calls

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: Advanced paramedics Lucy and Eliza come to the aid of a motorcyclist who has been hit by a taxi, while Shane and Shelly race to help a three-month-old baby.

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.sub-title: Hugo and the Ice Cream Pups
programme.desc: Pete meets some newborn pups fighting to survive, and helps teach Hugo, a Cane Corso rescued from quarantine at Dover, how to be a dog

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick faces one of his greatest practical and ethical challenges yet when hes introduced to Hermes, a tortoise with only one good leg. Can he provide Hermes with three prosthetic feet, using tiny titanium implants? Meanwhile, a rottweiler called Dave urgently needs an upgrade to his previous hip replacements

programme.title: One Born: What Happened Next?
programme.desc: Documentary revisiting some of One Born Every Minutes most memorable parents, including Lucy as she plans to pursue her goal of returning to professional opera singing two years after the birth of her third child. Kirri and Brendan are looking to recapture their youthful spark following the delivery of their second born. Plus, Detroit-born Shannon and her Yorkshire husband Chris try to combine the best of both worlds as they raise their two children

programme.title: One Born: What Happened Next?
programme.desc: Documentary revisiting some of One Born Every Minutes most memorable parents, including young couple Dan and Kerry who have responded to the challenges of parenthood in different ways. While Dan has embraced becoming a dad, Kerry has had to deal with an identity crisis. Plus, a chance to catch up with Marvin, whose long-distance job meant he nearly missed the birth of his daughter, and Dawn and Paul who, despite already having children from previous marriages, wanted to add to their family

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: A look at the busiest ambulance service in Sydney. Paramedics go to a warehouse where a forklift has rolled over and face a car accident where a pregnant womans waters have broken

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: Its the weekend and a rookie paramedic faces a confronting case, a young boy is trapped seizing in a bathroom, and a stranger must be convinced to perform lifesaving CPR

programme.title: DNA Family Secrets
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley meets five sisters in Lancashire who only found each other as adults. They know they all share the same mother, but want to find out if they also have the same father. Luke was a sperm donor as a university student in the late 1980s. He has now come forward to find out if any potential children might be looking for him. Identical twins Diane and Louise want to test their DNA to discover if they both carry the potentially deadly BRCA genetic mutation since they lost their mother to cancer

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson shares the origins of some of her ideas, revealing just how and why they came into being, including a bowl of steamed clams with Thai basil inspired by a holiday in Thailand. Her toasty olive oil granola was born out of a need to have a satisfying breakfast at the ready, while hunger pangs at the other end of the day led to a dish of griddled halloumi with a sweet chilli sauce. Finally, Nigellas friends are treated to a supper of griddled bavette steak, followed by a lemon pavlova

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the Britain of his youth, starting at Prestons Fulwood Barracks and heading to Bury Bolton Street Station in Greater Manchester

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillos railway journey reaches Greater Manchester, where he celebrates new beginnings for the nation in the years after the Second World War. At Trafford General Hospital, he investigates the birth of the National Health Service. A retired physiotherapist recalls her part in the historic event of July 5, 1948. Coronation Star tells Michael about the first episode of the soap, broadcast live in 1960. And at the citys Science and Industry Museum, the presenter encounters a replica of the Baby, which was created in 1948 - the first machine in the world to run a stored program and the forerunner of all modern computers

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels by tram to the former cotton town of Oldham on the edge of the Peak District. Here he visits Oldham Coliseum, the towns Victorian repertory theatre, and hears about the lifting of censorship by the Lord Chamberlains Office in the late 1960s. He then goes hiking before a visit to Sheffield, where he attends a knife-making workshop. He ends this part of his journey admiring the striking post-war sculptures of Barbara Hepworth at the Yorkshire Sculpture Park near Wakefield

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In Wakefield, West Yorkshire, Michael Portillo visits the National Coal Mining Museum for England at Caphouse Colliery. In Leeds, he heads for the Chapeltown area to investigate the origins of the Leeds West Indian carnival in 1967 and tries his hand on the steel drums

programme.title: Bangers and Cash

programme.desc: The story of how Winston Churchill tried to save France and destroy Hitler by destroying Britain and creating the Franco-British Union - a plan that was to crash and burn

programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team head to the Tamar Valley in Devon, and weigh anchor at Morwellham Quay

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: The Meldrews, Mrs Warboys and Nick Swainey spend a day boating on the river, but get marooned - so Victor sets out alone to fetch help and stumbles across a disturbing secret at an old peoples home. Richard Wilson stars

programme.desc: The Meldrews return home from a dreary holiday to find the neighbours about to sell their house to a weirdo - and while Victor is busy moaning about everything under the sun, Margaret considers embarking on an affair. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor is stuck at home while waiting to be called for jury service - but as time ticks on and his frustration grows, he begins to feel as if he is the one on trial. Richard Wilson stars in an episode featuring no other characters

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his post-war exploration of northwest England in Bradford, Shipley and Hebden Bridge. In Bradfords Centenary Square, he encounters local literary giant, JB Priestley. At Shipley station, Michael discovers a nature reserve in the middle of the car park. Finally the Calder Valley Line delivers the presenter to the photogenic station at Hebden Bridge

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Londons Docklands to the Barbican, examining the story of the arrival at Tilbury in 1948 of the Empire Windrush, which brought more than a thousand passengers from the Caribbean to work in Britain. In Limehouse, Michael reflects on the Labour Partys landslide victory at the post-war general election of 1945 and hears what drove new prime minister Clement Attlee to strive for social change

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits several of Londons most famous locations, beginning on the South Bank, where the 1951 Festival of Britain drew more than eight and a half million visitors to admire fantastical buildings designed to inspire and celebrate the best of British in art, science and industry. After a spin on the London Eye, built to celebrate the millennium, Michael takes the London Underground to Chelsea to find out about Elizabeth David, one of the most influential cookery writers of the 20th century, and also heads to Covent Garden and Regents Park

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo ventures deep underground onto Londons newest railway - the Elizabeth Line - enjoying a smooth ride from Paddington to Tottenham Court Road. Emerging into the sunshine in Bedford Square, Michael recalls the choking smogs which plagued the capital during the 1950s. He learns how smoke-free zones were introduced to tackle the problem and, high above the capital at the top of the BT Tower, discovers how the capitals air quality is monitored today

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: The lives of Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz, two of Americas most skilled pickers, who travel around the country trawling junk yards, garages, attics and barns for precious objects

programme.desc: Mike and Frank revisit New England and hope to discover the rusty gold that may have eluded them the first time through

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon OBrien restore eight items, including a pine blanket chest, a pair of battlefield telephones and some gothic church windows

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon OBrien converts tank parts to garden furniture, while Henry Cole takes his life in his hands with a motorised skateboard. Later, Simon restores a model Hurricane, and Henry goes potty for a retro petrol pump

programme.desc: Victor lands himself in a pickle thanks to a conjuring trick that proves to be far from magic, while busybody Mrs Warboys becomes convinced her husband is having an affair. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into the steeplejacks love of steam-powered engines and machinery. After spending a large part of his life studying their construction and history, he passed on this knowledge in his programmes and highlighted the importance of steam power in Britains past

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: The steeplejacks fascination with mining, which led him to dig his own coal mine in his back garden. Fred was also keen to teach viewers about the history of the industry, educating people about the dangers faced by those working down the pit, and the skills workers required

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: The steeplejacks interest in industrial engineering, which was sparked by the building of canals, railways and bridges near his Bolton home. The documentary visits Hadrians Wall, the canal tunnels in Dudley and Conways suspension bridge

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: The steeplejack shares his appreciation for the skills of the men who built Britains great castles, palaces and country houses. He draws on his experiences as an apprentice joiner to offer demonstrations of building techniques, including the humorous falling-down arch

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Made in Britain
programme.desc: Fred takes his traction engine across the mountains of Snowdonia to visit the Welsh Slate Museum, where all the machinery is driven by a single line shaft an eighth of a mile long

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Made in Britain
programme.desc: Fred navigates Snowdonia and the Llanberis Pass, before starting his journey from Bolton to Buckingham Palace to collect his MBE

programme.desc: Derek gets a tour of Hadlow Castle in Kent when he arrives to collect the owners pre-war Alvis and an immaculate Citroen used by the Gestapo in occupied France

Incensed by this, Bond refuses his next mission from MI6 to go in search of Sanchez, leaving M with no alternative but to revoke Bonds licence to kill. Now considered a rogue agent, Bond goes undercover to pose as an assassin for hire within Sanchezs drug empire, to bring him down from the inside. Analysis comes from Leonna Mayor and Tom Scudamore, with reports by Luke Harvey and Mick Fitzgerald, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Live League of Ireland
programme.desc: Drogheda United v Bohemians (Kick-off 4.30pm). Coverage of the match from the final round of fixtures in the Premier Division, held at Sullivan and Lambe Park. Both these teams and St Patricks Athletic are on 51 points and whoever finishes highest in the table will finish fourth and possibly earn a place in Europe. Only a win will do for Bohemians as they have the worst goal difference of the three teams, while St Pats have the best goal difference of the three so they are almost certain to finish above these two sides should they defeat Shelbourne

programme.title: Virgin Media News Update
programme.desc: The latest national and international news stories

programme.title: Live International Rugby Union
programme.desc: Ireland v New Zealand (Kick-off 8.10pm). All the action from the autumn international at Soldier Field in Chicago. This venue was the scene of Irelands first-ever victory over the All Blacks at the 29th attempt, when they won a thrilling encounter 40-29 in Soldier Field. The teams have won four matches apiece in their eight meetings since then, but New Zealand have prevailed in the last two - a 23-13 victory at Aviva Stadium 12 months ago and a 28-24 triumph in the quarter-finals of the 2023 Rugby World Cup in France

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by double Oscar nominee Keira Knightley, now turned childrens author with I Love You Just the Same. Plus, female education activist Malala Yousafzai talks about her new memoir Finding My Way, Aimee Lou Wood reflects on her role in BBC comedy series Daddy Issues and comedian Chris McCausland recounts his journey from comic to Strictly winner in Keep Laughing.Theres music from Mumford and Sons with Hozier, who perform their new single Rubber Band Man

programme.title: Living with Lucy
programme.desc: Lucy settles in with celebrity garden designer and TV personality Diarmuid Gavin, who talks about his turbulent relationship with fame and finding happiness in his family

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?

programme.desc: A look back at the career achievements and personal conflicts experienced by musician Sinead OConnor, who died in July 2023 at the age of 56

programme.title: Heartbeat

Gina receives a visit from her niece, who has fallen in with a bad crowd back in Manchester, while Liz enlists David to paint the surgery and sitting room - but is less than pleased with the results. Drama, starring Simon Molloy and Tricia Penrose

programme.desc: Part two of two. Meanwhile, Primrose makes an unusual request concerning affairs of the heart and Charley launches a bid to buy a local brewery. David Jason stars

Rural drama, starring Gwen Taylor and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: My Unique BandB
programme.desc: Simon Parfett and his team head to Somerset to work with Vicki and Bryan, who dream of spending less time at work and more time with their young family by turning a corner of their field into a unique BandB. They have a space-age geodome, but have no idea how to transform it into a welcoming rental. Simon and his team are full of ideas, including a large wooden statement bed and set of bunks, plus a botanical theme to bring warmth and colour to the large space. Its a big and physically challenging job, but with help from friends and family the team hopes to pull off an extraordinary transformation

Drama, starring Julia McKenzie in the title role, with Lynda Baron, Pauline Collins, Nicholas Parsons and Neil Pearson

programme.desc: A runaway heiress accompanies her crooked boyfriend on a series of armed robberies. Meanwhile, Peggy suggests David should take over the funeral parlour while Bernie is away. Rural drama with Sophie Ward, David Stockwell and Gwen Taylor

programme.desc: As the siege drags on in Tobruk, Harry leads a mission to find a source of drinking water. While they are successful in finding a well, tragedy strikes when they are caught out by a German ambush. In Manchester, Kasia is confronted by further horror of war when she discovers Irenas motives for spying for the Nazis. In France, romance blossoms between David and Henriette as they hide out in a farm

programme.desc: The Aidensfield bobbies investigate a series of arson attacks, but have trouble finding the evidence to convict their chief suspects _ until a further blaze claims a victim. Guest starring Ralf Little and Coronation Streets Alan Halsall (Tyrone Dobbs)

However, the novelists instincts tell her shes getting involved in something much darker - and shes proved right when the girl volunteering to play the part of the victim really does turn out to be dead. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Zoe Wanamaker, Sean Pertwee, Martin Jarvis, Sam Kelly, Sinead Cusack, Rosalind Ayres and Tom Ellis

programme.title: Marcus Wareings Tales from a Kitchen Garden
programme.desc: The chef visits a livestock auction, keen to learn as much as he can about owning and rearing livestock. He also visits a charity for a lesson in growing and harvesting pumpkins

programme.title: Marcus Wareings Tales from a Kitchen Garden
programme.desc: The chef considers adding goats to his Sussex smallholding, but as they are notoriously hard to look after, Marcus wants to find out more about them before taking the plunge

programme.desc: After having his career scrutinised by the General Medical Council because of his blood phobia, Martin makes efforts to overcome his fear and begins to question whether he made the right decision about resigning. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz

programme.desc: Conclusion. As the case unfolds, she becomes ever more involved with the suspect - which ultimately proves to have shattering consequences for her at Rosemarys trial. Drama telling the story of how the serial killers were brought to justice, starring Emily Watson, Dominic West, Monica Dolan and Robert Glenister

programme.title: Our House
programme.desc: Fi has to come to terms with losing the house and tries to find out more about Brams whereabouts. She turns to her new partner, Toby, for support, but he has secrets of his own. Thriller, starring Tuppence Middleton and Martin Compston

programme.desc: A naive Irish woman joins two lifelong friends at university in 1950s Dublin where, against the wishes of her strict parents, she falls for a dashing rugby player. Meanwhile, her pals - socially ambitious Nan and the more cautious Eve - pursue romances of their own. Drama, based on Maeve Binchys novel, with Minnie Driver, Saffron Burrows, Geraldine ORawe, Chris ODonnell and Colin Firth
